name: Intro and history of deep learning
desc: This lecture introduces the structure of the Deep Learning course, and gives a short overview of the history and motivation of Deep Learning.

name: Introduction to PyTorch
desc: This tutorial introduces the practical sessions, the TA organizer team, etc. Afterwards, we will discuss the PyTorch machine learning framework, and introduce you to the basic concepts of Tensors, computation graphs and GPU computation.

name: Manually forward, automatically backward
desc: This lecture covers the basics of forward and backward propagation in neural networks.

name: Deep learning optimization I
desc: This lecture covers the first part of deep learning optimization techniques.

name: Activation Functions
desc: In this tutorial, we will discuss the role of activation functions in a neural network, and take a closer look at the optimization issues a poorly designed activation function can have.

name: Deep learning optimization II
desc: This lecture covers the second part of deep learning optimization techniques.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks I
desc: This lecture covers the first part of Convolutional Neural Networks.

name: Optimization and Initialization
desc: In this tutorial, we will discuss the importance of proper parameter initialization in deep neural networks, and how we can find a suitable one for our network. In addition, we will review the optimizers SGD and Adam, and compare them on complex loss surfaces.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks II
desc: This lecture covers the second part of Convolutional Neural Networks.

name: Attention
desc: This lecture covers attention mechanisms in deep learning.

name: Inception, ResNet and DenseNet
desc: In this tutorial, we will implement three popular, modern ConvNet architectures: GoogleNet, ResNet, and DenseNet. We will compare them on the CIFAR10 dataset, and discuss the advantages that made them popular and successful across many tasks.

name: Graph Neural Networks
desc: This lecture covers Graph Neural Networks.

name: Self-supervised and vision-language learning
desc: This lecture covers self-supervised learning and vision-language learning.

name: Transformers and Multi-Head Attention
desc: In this tutorial, we will discuss the relatively new breakthrough architecture: Transformers. We will start from the basics of attention and multi-head attention, and build our own Transformer.

name: Auto-encoding and generation
desc: This lecture covers auto-encoding and generation techniques in deep learning.

name: The oddities of deep learning
desc: This lecture covers various unusual aspects and phenomena in deep learning.

name: Graph Neural Networks
desc: In this tutorial, we will discuss the implementation of Graph Neural Networks. In the first part of the tutorial, we will implement the GCN and GAT layer ourselves. In the second part, we use PyTorch Geometric to look at node-level, edge-level and graph-level tasks.

name: Non-Euclidean deep learning
desc: This lecture covers deep learning techniques for non-Euclidean data.

name: Deep learning for videos
desc: This lecture covers deep learning techniques for video processing.

name: Self-Supervised Contrastive Learning with SimCLR
desc: In this tutorial, we will explore self-supervised contrastive learning using the SimCLR framework.

name: Q&A
desc: Question and Answer session for the course.
